allPokemon.name: bulbasaur
allPokemon.description: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight.  There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays,  the seed grows progressively larger.

allPokemon.name: ivysaur
allPokemon.description: There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. To support its weight,  Ivysaur’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong.  If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight,  it’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

allPokemon.name: venusaur
allPokemon.description: There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said  to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight.  The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.

allPokemon.name: charmander
allPokemon.description: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication  of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander  is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged,  the flame burns fiercely.

allPokemon.name: charmeleon
allPokemon.description: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp  claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive.  In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with  a bluish white color.

allPokemon.name: charizard
allPokemon.description: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents.  It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything.  However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent  weaker than itself.

allPokemon.name: squirtle
allPokemon.description: Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection.  The shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its  surface help minimize resistance in water,  enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.

allPokemon.name: wartortle
allPokemon.description: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail  becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages.  The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s  toughness as a battler.

allPokemon.name: blastoise
allPokemon.description: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell.  The water spouts are very accurate.  They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy  to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

allPokemon.name: caterpie
allPokemon.description: Perhaps because it would like to grow up  quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating  a hundred leaves a day.

allPokemon.name: metapod
allPokemon.description: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the  cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in  preparation for evolution.

allPokemon.name: butterfree
allPokemon.description: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds  bird Pokémon going after Caterpie, Butterfree  sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.

allPokemon.name: weedle
allPokemon.description: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable  of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it  dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).

allPokemon.name: kakuna
allPokemon.description: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree.  However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares  for its coming evolution.  This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.

allPokemon.name: beedrill
allPokemon.description: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach  its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack  in a furious swarm.

allPokemon.name: pidgey
allPokemon.description: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction.  It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest,  however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

allPokemon.name: pidgeotto
allPokemon.description: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This  Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory  is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe  with its sharp claws.

allPokemon.name: pidgeot
allPokemon.description: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully  glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the  striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling  them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

allPokemon.name: rattata
allPokemon.description: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life.  If its incisors get too long, this Pokémon  becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.

allPokemon.name: raticate
allPokemon.description: People say that it fled from its enemies by  using its small webbed hind feet to swim  from island to island in Alola.

allPokemon.name: spearow
allPokemon.description: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to  others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect  its territory.

allPokemon.name: fearow
allPokemon.description: Carrying food through Fearow’s territory is  dangerous. It will snatch the food away from  you in a flash!

allPokemon.name: ekans
allPokemon.description: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

allPokemon.name: arbok
allPokemon.description: The latest research has determined that there  are over 20 possible arrangements of the  patterns on its stomach.

allPokemon.name: pikachu
allPokemon.description: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests  where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous,  since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

allPokemon.name: raichu
allPokemon.description: As electricity builds up inside its body, it  becomes more aggressive. One theory is that  the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.

allPokemon.name: sandshrew
allPokemon.description: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger  approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its  soft stomach.

allPokemon.name: sandslash
allPokemon.description: Its claws and horns often break off. The broken  claws and horns can be used to carve plows for  tilling farm fields.

allPokemon.name: nidoran-f
allPokemon.description: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison.  They are thought to have developed as protection for  this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases  a horrible toxin from its horn.

allPokemon.name: nidorina
allPokemon.description: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep  their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other.  This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated  from the others.

allPokemon.name: nidoqueen
allPokemon.description: Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales.  It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This  Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.

allPokemon.name: nidoran-m
allPokemon.description: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks  to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even  the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.

allPokemon.name: nidorino
allPokemon.description: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses  a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once,  and it challenges the foe with all its might.

allPokemon.name: nidoking
allPokemon.description: Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power.  With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once  this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

allPokemon.name: clefairy
allPokemon.description: They’re popular, but they’re rare. Trainers who  show them off recklessly may be targeted  by thieves.

allPokemon.name: clefable
allPokemon.description: It can’t help but hear a pin drop from over half  a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains  where there aren’t many people or Pokémon.

allPokemon.name: vulpix
allPokemon.description: Its beautiful tails have made it very popular.  However, if it’s not brushed diligently, it will  be a mass of tangles before you know it.

allPokemon.name: ninetales
allPokemon.description: It is vindictive and relentless by nature.  Those who cross it even once will be cursed for  a thousand years, along with their descendants.

allPokemon.name: jigglypuff
allPokemon.description: Recordings of Jigglypuff’s strange lullabies can  be purchased from department stores. These  CDs can be found near the bedding area.

allPokemon.name: wigglytuff
allPokemon.description: Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur,  this Pokémon is sought after. Holding one  in your arms while you sleep feels great.

allPokemon.name: zubat
allPokemon.description: It has no eyeballs, so it can’t see. It checks its  surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits  from its mouth.

allPokemon.name: golbat
allPokemon.description: Every once in a while, you’ll see a Golbat that’s  missing some fangs. This happens when hunger  drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokémon.

allPokemon.name: oddish
allPokemon.description: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself.  During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet  are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots  of trees.

allPokemon.name: gloom
allPokemon.description: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely  horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the  noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.

allPokemon.name: vileplume
allPokemon.description: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to  attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the  prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.

allPokemon.name: paras
allPokemon.description: Whether it’s due to a lack of moisture or a lack  of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras  don’t grow up quite right.

allPokemon.name: parasect
allPokemon.description: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on  its back having become the main body. If the  mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.

allPokemon.name: venonat
allPokemon.description: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair  that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large  eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.

allPokemon.name: venomoth
allPokemon.description: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes  active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather  around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.

allPokemon.name: diglett
allPokemon.description: It travels through tunnels that it digs  underground. It hates sunlight, so it comes  out only after the sun goes down.

allPokemon.name: dugtrio
allPokemon.description: While the three of them normally get along  splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will  break out over which head gets to eat first.

allPokemon.name: meowth
allPokemon.description: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight  of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over  shiny objects.

allPokemon.name: persian
allPokemon.description: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to  be a different color than those of Alolan  Persian, it’s mostly made of the same material.

allPokemon.name: psyduck
allPokemon.description: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it  normally passes the time spacing out and doing  as little as possible.

allPokemon.name: golduck
allPokemon.description: Even fast-swimming fish Pokémon can be  disabled by Golduck. It brings them to a  standstill and seizes them.

allPokemon.name: mankey
allPokemon.description: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its  temper. Because it doesn’t hold in its stress,  this Pokémon can live a long time.

allPokemon.name: primeape
allPokemon.description: It will never forgive opponents who have  angered it. Even after it has beaten them down  until they can’t move, it never ever forgives.

allPokemon.name: growlithe
allPokemon.description: While it’s quite friendly toward humans once it’s  grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite  fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.

allPokemon.name: arcanine
allPokemon.description: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general  and conquering a whole country.

allPokemon.name: poliwag
allPokemon.description: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land.  So it does its best to waddle along, but when  an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

allPokemon.name: poliwhirl
allPokemon.description: Although it has become capable of living on  land, it spends its time in the water, where  its prey, fish Pokémon, are plentiful.

allPokemon.name: poliwrath
allPokemon.description: It’s quite a gifted swimmer, even among  Water-type Pokémon, but it normally spends its  time on land.

allPokemon.name: abra
allPokemon.description: It uses various psychic powers even while it’s  sleeping, so you can’t tell whether or not  it’s awake.

allPokemon.name: kadabra
allPokemon.description: It stares at a silver spoon to amplify its psychic  powers before it lets loose. Apparently, gold  spoons are no good.

allPokemon.name: alakazam
allPokemon.description: Alakazam uses its psychic powers to make the  spoons it carries. Each spoon is an original that  there’s only one of in the whole world.

allPokemon.name: machop
allPokemon.description: Once this Pokémon has gained enough  confidence and muscle from training with its  friends, it challenges Makuhita to a battle.

allPokemon.name: machoke
allPokemon.description: When it encounters an enemy that’s truly  mighty, this Pokémon removes the power-save  belt from its waist and unleashes its full power.

allPokemon.name: machamp
allPokemon.description: It grasps its opponents with its four arms and  twists them up in an intricate hold. People call  it “the Machamp special.”

allPokemon.name: bellsprout
allPokemon.description: Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway  to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth,  this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

allPokemon.name: weepinbell
allPokemon.description: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the  Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep.  If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself  on the ground.

allPokemon.name: victreebel
allPokemon.description: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head.  This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal  to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near,  this Pokémon swallows it whole.

allPokemon.name: tentacool
allPokemon.description: It drifts through the sea searching for prey.  Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes,  but after a while, they grow back.

allPokemon.name: tentacruel
allPokemon.description: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs  to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up  in its 80 tentacles.

allPokemon.name: geodude
allPokemon.description: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all  their edges smoothed out until they’re totally  round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

allPokemon.name: graveler
allPokemon.description: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak  of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit,  it rolls back down the way it came.

allPokemon.name: golem
allPokemon.description: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their  shells. Those that have lived a long, long time  have shells green with moss.

allPokemon.name: ponyta
allPokemon.description: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up.  This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and  falling to keep up with its parent.

allPokemon.name: rapidash
allPokemon.description: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields  and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its  fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

allPokemon.name: slowpoke
allPokemon.description: There are some places where Slowpoke is  worshiped because of a long-standing belief  that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.

allPokemon.name: slowbro
allPokemon.description: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back  into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder,  breaks off.

allPokemon.name: magnemite
allPokemon.description: It’s frequently the cause of power outages,  which is why some power plants send out  electrical signals that it can’t stand.

allPokemon.name: magneton
allPokemon.description: Delicate equipment can malfunction in areas  inhabited by Magneton, which send out  mysterious electrical signals.

allPokemon.name: farfetchd
allPokemon.description: Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some  sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This  Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.

allPokemon.name: doduo
allPokemon.description: Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A  scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be  examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.

allPokemon.name: dodrio
allPokemon.description: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that  Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as  well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.

allPokemon.name: seel
allPokemon.description: It has always been supposed that Seel live only  in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is  a mystery.

allPokemon.name: dewgong
allPokemon.description: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight  knots, searching for Pokémon that will become  its prey. It’s especially fond of Wishiwashi.

allPokemon.name: grimer
allPokemon.description: It was born from sludge on the ocean floor. In a  sterile environment, the germs within its body  can’t multiply, and it dies.

allPokemon.name: muk
allPokemon.description: Their food sources have decreased, and their  numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds  are being built to prevent their extinction.

allPokemon.name: shellder
allPokemon.description: The sand that accumulates inside its shell  eventually becomes a pearl. But the pearl gets  in the way, so it spits it out and discards it.

allPokemon.name: cloyster
allPokemon.description: If areas of Cloyster’s very hard shell get  damaged, those areas swell, gradually growing  into large sharp spikes.

allPokemon.name: gastly
allPokemon.description: It’s said that gas emanating from a graveyard  was possessed by the grievances of the  deceased and thus became a Pokémon.

allPokemon.name: haunter
allPokemon.description: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for  someone to curse, so it’s best not to go out  walking around.

allPokemon.name: gengar
allPokemon.description: You can hear tales told all over the world about  how Gengar will pay a visit to children who  are naughty.

allPokemon.name: onix
allPokemon.description: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that  this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling.  As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder  and smoother.

allPokemon.name: drowzee
allPokemon.description: It can be spotted near recreational facilities,  intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children  who enjoyed themselves there that day.

allPokemon.name: hypno
allPokemon.description: In Alola, Komala is Hypno’s main target. It rarely  harms people.

allPokemon.name: krabby
allPokemon.description: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into  the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food,  these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other  over territory.

allPokemon.name: kingler
allPokemon.description: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge  claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because  the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.

allPokemon.name: voltorb
allPokemon.description: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest  of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a  Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.

allPokemon.name: electrode
allPokemon.description: One of Electrode’s characteristics is its attraction to electricity.  It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at  electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just  been generated.

allPokemon.name: exeggcute
allPokemon.description: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one  of the six be lost, the next morning there will  once more be six.

allPokemon.name: exeggutor
allPokemon.description: It engages its enemies using psychic powers.  Each of its three heads fires off psychokinetic  energy, tripling its power.

allPokemon.name: cubone
allPokemon.description: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother,  but those cries only attract its natural  enemy—Mandibuzz.

allPokemon.name: marowak
allPokemon.description: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down.  It’s thought that Marowak is trying to avenge  its parent.

allPokemon.name: hitmonlee
allPokemon.description: Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these  springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks.  After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles  to overcome fatigue.

allPokemon.name: hitmonchan
allPokemon.description: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had  been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon  has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face  of adversity.

allPokemon.name: lickitung
allPokemon.description: It checks out whatever’s around it by licking  everything. If you don’t clean off a spot where  it’s licked you, you’ll break out in a rash!

allPokemon.name: koffing
allPokemon.description: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw  garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly  powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas  is concocted by this Pokémon.

allPokemon.name: weezing
allPokemon.description: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix  together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed,  the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also  becomes more putrid.

allPokemon.name: rhyhorn
allPokemon.description: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run  it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently  remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.

allPokemon.name: rhydon
allPokemon.description: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for  destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally  rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents  it from feeling the heat.

allPokemon.name: chansey
allPokemon.description: It seems that other Pokémon’s efforts to take  its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused  Chansey to get faster at fleeing.

allPokemon.name: tangela
allPokemon.description: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This  happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway.  The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very  next day.

allPokemon.name: kangaskhan
allPokemon.description: Kangaskhan protects its child by keeping it in  its pouch. It has zero forgiveness for those  who harm its child and will beat them down.

allPokemon.name: horsea
allPokemon.description: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense  black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon  swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.

allPokemon.name: seadra
allPokemon.description: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body.  The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even  fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with  these currents, then swallows it whole.

allPokemon.name: goldeen
allPokemon.description: Although known for their splendid tail fins,  Goldeen apparently compete among themselves  to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.

allPokemon.name: seaking
allPokemon.description: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out  rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the  male is more vivid.

allPokemon.name: staryu
allPokemon.description: In many places, there are folktales of stardust  falling into the ocean and becoming Staryu.

allPokemon.name: starmie
allPokemon.description: Its sparkling core is called “the gem of the sea.”  This core can be made into high-priced  accessories that are traded in secret.

allPokemon.name: mr-mime
allPokemon.description: Its pantomime skills are wonderful. You may  become enraptured while watching it, but next  thing you know, Mr. Mime has made a real wall.

allPokemon.name: scyther
allPokemon.description: Its two sharp scythes are more than just  weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress  its prey before eating.

allPokemon.name: jynx
allPokemon.description: It sways its hips to a rhythm all its own. The  precise movements of Jynx living in Alola are  truly wonderful.

allPokemon.name: electabuzz
allPokemon.description: Electricity permeates its body. It swings  its arms round and round to charge up  electricity before unleashing a punch.

allPokemon.name: magmar
allPokemon.description: Its entire body is burning. When it breathes,  the temperature rises. When it sneezes, flames  shoot out!

allPokemon.name: pinsir
allPokemon.description: It gets into territorial disputes with Vikavolt.  For some reason, it apparently gets along well  with Heracross in Alola.

allPokemon.name: tauros
allPokemon.description: They live in groups. The one with the longest,  thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss  of the herd.

allPokemon.name: magikarp
allPokemon.description: In the distant past, they were fairly strong, but  they have become gradually weaker over time.

allPokemon.name: gyarados
allPokemon.description: It fires hyper beams in all directions, burning the  surrounding area to ash. There are some regions  where it’s called “the deity of destruction.”

allPokemon.name: lapras
allPokemon.description: It likes swimming around with people on its  back. In the Alola region, it’s an important means  of transportation over water.

allPokemon.name: ditto
allPokemon.description: While it can transform into anything, each Ditto  apparently has its own strengths and  weaknesses when it comes to transformations.

allPokemon.name: eevee
allPokemon.description: The question of why only Eevee has such  unstable genes has still not been solved.

allPokemon.name: vaporeon
allPokemon.description: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When  it’s about to be attacked by an invading enemy,  it dives into the water to hide.

allPokemon.name: jolteon
allPokemon.description: Its lungs contain an organ that creates  electricity. The crackling sound of electricity  can be heard when it exhales.

allPokemon.name: flareon
allPokemon.description: If it inhales deeply, that’s a sign it’s about to  attack. Prepare to be hit by flames of over  3,000 degrees Fahrenheit!

allPokemon.name: porygon
allPokemon.description: This Pokémon was created using the  cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so  many parts of it have since become obsolete.

allPokemon.name: omanyte
allPokemon.description: Omanyte lived in the seas of antiquity. Its  fossils have been found bearing bite marks from  Archeops, so apparently Archeops preyed on it.

allPokemon.name: omastar
allPokemon.description: Its heavy shell is thought to be the reason this  ancient Pokémon died out. It’s apparently a  distant ancestor of Octillery.

allPokemon.name: kabuto
allPokemon.description: This Pokémon thrived 300 million years ago. It’s  said that living specimens can still be seen  in a certain region—a rare sight.

allPokemon.name: kabutops
allPokemon.description: Its body had begun to change so it could  function on land. But it didn’t adapt in time and  went extinct.

allPokemon.name: aerodactyl
allPokemon.description: Restored from DNA found in amber, this  Pokémon exhibited ferocity that was greater  than expected. Some casualties resulted.

allPokemon.name: snorlax
allPokemon.description: It doesn’t do anything other than eat and sleep.  When prompted to make a serious effort,  though, it apparently displays awesome power.

allPokemon.name: articuno
allPokemon.description: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice.  The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said  that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

allPokemon.name: zapdos
allPokemon.description: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability  to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds.  The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

allPokemon.name: moltres
allPokemon.description: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability  to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its  body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

allPokemon.name: dratini
allPokemon.description: It’s still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies  of water, eating whatever food sinks down and  living a quiet life.

allPokemon.name: dragonair
allPokemon.description: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with  offerings from people, because they believe this  Pokémon is able to control the weather.

allPokemon.name: dragonite
allPokemon.description: It flies over raging seas as if they were nothing.  Observing this, a ship’s captain dubbed this  Pokémon “the sea incarnate.”

allPokemon.name: mewtwo
allPokemon.description: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic  manipulation. However, even though the scientific power  of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to  endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.
